Also included is a bonus "Optional Guide" disc which includes an illustration gallery and play videos of each mission, as well as a set of trading cards.
title: Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny

description:
A television station is holding tryouts to find a new pop idol to represent the company. After several rounds of auditions, only eight young women remain in the running. The final test, to determine both their intelligence and luck, is a mahjong tournament! Whoever wins the tournament also wins the audition, and the competition is fierce.

Mezase Idol Star!! is a 1-on-1 mahjong game featuring a cast of aspiring young idols, each portrayed by a real-life actress. The player takes the part of a manager and selects a girl to represent in the tournament; to win the audition, the player must defeat all seven of the other girls at mahjong. The game also includes profiles and a photo gallery of each girl, and additional swimsuit photos are unlocked after clearing each girl's scenario.
title: Mezase Idol Star!! Natsuiro Memories: Mahjong-hen

description: Wangan Dead Heat + Real Arrange is an updated release of Wangan Dead Heat. This version features a new cast of companion models to impress with your racing skills; five real-life race models appear in video form. There is no new content such as tracks or cars, but the gameplay has been tweaked and adjusted, and there is a second disc included which contains video clips of each of the models.
title: Wangan Dead Heat + Real Arrange

description:
In the near future, an epidemic of crime and gun violence has swept across Japan. To counteract this threat, the secret police force JSWAT — Japanese Special Weapons and Tactics — has been formed. They are called in for the most dangerous missions, from gang warfare to hostage situations, and you are the newest recruit.

Tokusō Kidōtai JSWAT is a police-themed, first-person shooter with live-action cutscenes and digitized graphics. For each mission, the player must select a weapon loadout and attempt to neutralize all threats. While lethal force is available as an option, subduing and arresting criminals is the preferred approach, and is reflected as such in mission rankings. The player must also be careful not to harm hostages and civilians, and pay attention to instructions received over radio during each mission.
title: Tokusō Kidōtai JSWAT

description: Taikyoku Shōgi: Kiwame II is a digital conversion of the traditional Japanese board game shogi for one or two players, and part of the Kiwame series of computer shogi games. This version is similar to the previous release, including all of the same features including multiple skill levels, 2-player play, recording and playback of games, and board setup features, but includes a further-refined play algorithm with updated play data. The tsumeshogi mode has also been expanded with 300 tsumeshogi problems, 300 next move problems, and an additional 150 "appreciation" problems.
title: Taikyoku Shōgi: Kiwame II

description:
Feng Shui is a traditional Chinese practice which posits that the physical layout of a landscape or other space determines how spiritual energy moves through it, in turn affecting the health and prosperity of that place and the people within.

Feng-Shui Master is an abstract simulation game based on that practice. Each stage consists of a city which the player can move around in first-person, filled with buildings, roads, and other structures and objects. Objects can be moved and adjusted, demolished and rebuilt, and the goal is to rearrange each area in accordance with Feng Shui practice in order to improve the city's prosperity and earn a certain amount of money. The player has a limited amount of money to make changes, but improving the energy flow and prosperity will increase the income and allow for further changes to be made. There are a total of seven stages, and the game also includes in-game book and video resources that explain the basics of Feng Shui.
title: Feng-Shui Master

description:
While searching for food for his village, the pig Lucas climbed a huge tree in hopes of stealing the eggs from a giant bird's nest. However, when he reached the nest, the mother bird saw him and chased him away. Upon returning to his village in defeat, Lucas finds all the homes ransacked and everyone gone but one young piglet, who is snatched away by a bird right before his eyes. Lucas sets out to rescue the piglets, and his journey will take him all across the island.

Minami no Shima ni Buta ga Ita: Lucas no Daibōken ("There was a Pig on the South Island: Lucas' Great Adventure") is a puzzle game featuring an assortment of logic puzzles. The game is divided into six themed worlds, and each world is divided into six levels in two types. Even-numbered stages are simple platform action sequences where Lucas can jump and use a whip to attack, avoiding enemies and looking for piglets to rescue. Odd-numbered stages take the form of various logic puzzles similar to those one might find in a puzzle magazine, such as arranging numbers to have them all add up to a certain sum, or rolling dice around so that they all show the same image on their face. These puzzles can be skipped, but clearing them will rescue a larger number of piglets.
title: Minami no Shima ni Buta ga Ita: Lucas no Daibōken

description:
Heartbeat Scramble is a love simulation game in the style of Tokimeki Memorial, in which the player takes the part of a high school student trying to keep up with his studies, a part-time job and, of course, a healthy social life. Unusual among such games, all the in-game characters and locations are portrayed using photographs of real-life actors, rather than the illustrated characters usually found in dating sims.

The game follows the main character through three years of high school life. The player can choose an activity for each day, such as studying or going to a part-time job to earn money, which affects their status and relationships with six potential romantic interests. The player can ask girls out on dates, and numerous events happen at fixed dates, such as school festivals, a ski resort trip, and ultimately graduation.
title: Heartbeat Scramble

description: Galaxy Fräulein Yuna Remix is a remake of the original PC Engine game. The gameplay and story are identical to the original release, but this version features completely redrawn graphics at a higher quality, newly-arranged music, and additional newly-recorded voiceovers. There is also some additional bonus content such as an illustration gallery. The package also includes a 1997 calendar featuring new artwork by series illustrator Mika Akitaka.
title: Ginga Ojōsama Densetsu Yuna Remix

description: This special edition release of MeltyLancer: Re-inforce includes the game along with an audio drama CD.
title: MeltyLancer: Re-inforce (Special Edition)

description:
Five young goddesses have been summoned on the orders of God: there's a shortage of guardians on Earth, and to decide who among them is fit to protect the people of Earth, these goddesses must prove their abilities through a test of leadership and compassion.

Pup-Breeder is a simulation game where the player takes the role of one of the goddesses, who is tasked with raising angelic creatures called "pups". These pups come in many different forms, which each have their own abilities and personalities — some may be good at fighting, some may have strong defense, some might have high agility or other unique skills — and the player starts out by selecting a team of five. Each of the pups functions like a virtual pet-style creature, tracking not only its health but also its trust and affection with the player.

The player character does not appear directly in the world or control the pups directly, but rather can issue commands to each of the pups such as to move or stop, use an item, attack a target, or activate a special ability. There are a variety of different missions which each have a different goal, such as causing the sun to rise, collecting shards of shooting stars, or defeating an evil familiar.
title: Pup-Breeder

description:
Virtual Kyōtei: Nekkyō Pennant Race is a simulation of kyōtei boat racing, a specific kind of boat racing popular in Japan for betting, in which small hydroplane craft are raced on an oval course in a man-made lake. It is the first entry in a series, a follow-up to the earlier Super Kyōtei games produced by Nichibutsu for the Super Famicom, and also features an official license from the Japan Motor Boat Racing Association.

There are two main game modes: Kyōtei Eiyū Retsuden ("Boat Racing Hero Chronicle") is the main career mode where the player creates a racer and must increase their rank to become a champion and win the seven SG-class races; and the Time Trial mode where the player can practice the course either solo or with a full field and save their best times. There is also a kyōtei library mode where the player can read about the basics and specific strategies involved in the sport, and a watch mode where the player can set up a field of any six racers and watch a simulated race.
title: Virtual Kyōtei: Nekkyō Pennant Race

description:
Virtual Kyōtei 2 is a simulation of kyōtei boat racing, and the sequel to the previous game. It features an official license from the Japan Motor Boat Racing Association, as well as the Racer's Association meaning this version includes the names and stats of over 500 real-life racers contemporary to the 1997 racing season.

There are two main modes available: Eiyū Densetsu ("Hero Legend") is the main career mode, where the player creates a new racer and attempts to win the seven main cups of kyōtei racing; the time trial mode in the previous edition has been replaced with VS Mode, introducing two-player split screen racing to the series for the first and only time. The watch and library modes from the previous game also return, allowing the player to set up dream matches and read about kyōtei basics and strategy.
title: Virtual Kyōtei 2

description: GeGeGe no Kitarō: Gentō Kaikitan is a sound novel adventure game based on the long-running manga series originally created by Shigeru Mizuki. It's winter, and snow has started to fall in the forest where Kitarō and his friends live... but even during winter, snow never normally falls in their forest, and Kitarō worries about what this might mean. The game follows standard sound novel format, with unvoiced dialogue and narration over still images depicting the current scene, occasionally interrupted by choices which branch the story path. There are three main scenarios that can unfold — one in which Kitarō investigates the recent disappearance of bodies, one in which he investigates the source of the mysterious snow, and one in which a fake copy of Kitarō himself appears — each with multiple endings depending on the player's choices.
title: GeGeGe no Kitarō: Gentō Kaikitan

description:
Fire Prowrestling S: 6Men Scramble is a pro wrestling game and part of the long-running Fire Pro Wrestling series. The arcade-style format is largely unchanged from previous entries; as the name suggests, the key new feature in this entry is 6-player simultaneous matches in both tag-team and battle royal formats.

Numerous game modes are available: Victory Road is the single-player campaign mode where the player must defeat a series of opponents to win the title belt; One Night Match is a standard exhibition match mode; Open League and One Night Tournament are tournament modes; and Elimination Match, Battle Royal, Death Match, and Gruesome Fighting are all special exhibition match types with specific rules or ring setups. The series' famously robust create-a-wrestler mode also makes an appearance, allowing the player to create completely custom wrestlers in both appearance and move set, which can then be used in any of the other game modes.
title: Fire Prowrestling S: 6Men Scramble

description:
Mechanical Violator Hakaider: Last Judgement is a light-gun rail shooter with light adventure elements based on the 1995 tokusatsu film Mechanical Violator Hakaider. Set 10 years after the events of the film, the player controls the titular anti-hero android Hakaider as he returns to Jesus Town in order to defeat Professor Gil and recover the arm that he lost in a battle against Waruda.

Each mission consists of one or more first-person shooting gallery-style segments against either waves of enemies or a boss character, in which the player must shoot down targets and projectiles without taking too much damage. The player has several different weapons to choose from, which have different effectiveness and ammo limits. Certain segments also take the form of a simplified first-person adventure, where the player can explore environments and talk to characters, and there are occasional choices for the player to make which may affect the following action sequence.
title: Mechanical Violator Hakaider: Last Judgement

description: Ultraman: Hikari no Kyojin Densetsu is a 1-on-1 fighting game based on the Ultraman series of TV shows. The game features pre-rendered character graphics in fully-3D environments, though it plays strictly on a 2D plane. There are a total of 15 characters available — 5 Ultra Heroes and 10 kaiju monsters — and two main game modes: Ultra Mode is the main story mode where the player selects one of the heroes and attempts to defeat all of the monsters, while the VS modes let one or two players freely battle using any of the characters. Unlike some previous Ultraman games, the player does not need to defeat monsters with the same special move as in the original TV show, though doing so will grant bonus points.
title: Ultraman: Hikari no Kyojin Densetsu

description:
This limited-edition release of MeltyLancer: Ginga Shōjo Keisatsu 2086 includes the game along with several bonus items:

  • A 12-track audio CD containing music, drama tracks, and answering machine messages
  • A MeltyLancer-branded CD wallet
  • A 1997 calendar featuring MeltyLancer artwork
title: MeltyLancer: Ginga Shōjo Keisatsu 2086 (Special Edition)

description:
This Sega Saturn version of MeltyLancer: Re-inforce was released five months after the original PlayStation version of the game, and includes numerous changes and additions:

  • Battles have been redesigned in a turn-based tactical format rather than the semi-real-time format of the original.
  • New events have been added to the game, including several which make use of the Saturn's real time clock.
  • Several mini-games have been changed or replaced.
title: MeltyLancer: Re-inforce

description:
Chaos Control Remix is, as the name suggests, a modified and updated version of Chaos Control featuring numerous changes and new features compared to the original Japanese release, some but not all of which were present in the European Saturn release:

  • 2-player simultaneous play has been added
  • Virtua Gun light gun support has been added
  • Area 2 of the original game (Virtual) has been removed, leaving only the Manhattan and Space areas
  • Improved video quality and load times
  • Game has generally been rebalanced to be more difficult
title: Chaos Control Remix

description:
This double-pack bundles together two games from the King of Fighters series:

  • The King of Fighters '95
  • The King of Fighters '96

Also included is a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: The King of Fighters '96 + '95 (Gentei KOF Double Pack)

description: This release of The King of Fighters '96 includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: The King of Fighters '96 (Okaidoku Set)

description: This release of Samurai Shodown III: Blades of Blood includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: Samurai Spirits: Zankurō Musōken (Okaidoku Set)

description: This limited-edition release of Sakura Taisen contains the game along with a Shuttle Mouse controller, a mouse pad, a poster, and a sheet of stickers, all packaged in an oversized box. Two versions of this package were released, "A Type" and "B Type", with the only difference being the design of the artwork printed on the mouse pad. A later reissue used the same artwork as the A Type but with a slightly different design.
title: Sakura Taisen (Tokubetsu Genteiban)

description: This special-edition release of Angelique Special includes the game along with a "Sweet Guide" guide book and a card-sized 1998 calendar.
title: Angelique Special (Premium Pack)

description: This release of Kōtetsu Reiiki Steeldom includes the game along with a serial Link Cable accessory.
title: Kōtetsu Reiiki Steeldom (Taisen Cable Dōkonban)

description: This special release of Saturn Bomberman is modified to exclusively support online play via the Sega Saturn Modem and XBand service, a feature which was not present in the original Japanese release of the game. The gameplay is identical to the regular version, but normal mode is not present and battle mode is restricted to online play only. If the game does not detect a modem peripheral, it boots into a simplified single-player "Master Game" mode with a single stage that gives the player a ranking at the end.
title: Saturn Bomberman (SegaNet Senyō)

description: This special release of Cyber Troopers Virtual On is modified to exclusively support online play via the Sega Saturn Modem and XBand service. Unlike the "Net Link Edition" released internationally, this version has all single-player and local-mutiplayer options stripped out; gameplay is restricted to online play only.
title: Cyber Troopers Virtual On for SegaNet

description:
Master of Monsters: Neo Generations is a fantasy-themed, turn-based hex strategy game and part of SystemSoft's Master of Monsters series. Like previous games in the series, each player controls a Master who can summon various creatures onto the battlefield to fight for them. These creatures can be upgraded and fused to increase their power and evolve them into more advanced forms, are consistent across maps once summoned, and are gone permanently if killed. The goal of each battle is to defeat the opposing master; if a master is killed, all their creatures vanish from the map and they lose the battle.

In the main story mode, the player selects one of six masters each with different abilities, backstory, and pool of available summon creatures. Over a series of battles on varied maps the player must defeat the other five masters and, ultimately, Gaia himself to claim his throne. There is also a map-select mode where any map can be played outside the story mode, a vs mode for two players, and a map-edit mode.

A heavily revised PlayStation port which replaces the master characters with more anime-style designs, adds an in-depth story component, and redesigns some of the maps was released the following year as Master of Monsters: Disciples of Gaia.
title: Master of Monsters: Neo Generations

description:
Somewhere in the distant reaches of space, there exists a society where magic and technology coexist. In this world, peace is maintained by four great cards representing human emotions — Joy, Anger, Grief, and Pleasure. However, the Kingdom of Yoshimole, which protects the Card of Joy, has suddenly come under attack by the Rokuna Empire, which holds the Card of Anger, and strange monsters have appeared all over! The Queen of Yoshimole, Bunny Bee, escapes with her two retainers Riki and Alter, and together they must fight back against the Rokuna Empire and save their homeland.

Funky Fantasy is a comedy-fantasy turn-based strategy RPG. Many of the characters and situations are parodies of popular contemporary games and media, and the cast consists of comedians and actors from Yoshimoto Kogyo, the largest comedy talent agency in Japan at the time. Gameplay is similar to titles like Tactics Ogre with the player controlling Bunny Bee and a team of fighters on grid-based maps against various opponents. Each turn consists of a Move phase, in which the player can position their units, followed by an Attack phase, where the player can attack enemy units or perform other actions.

A key feature is that Bunny Bee can summon monsters on the battlefield to fight for her, similar to Master of Monsters. Each chapter consists of several battle culminating in a boss encounter, and is strictly linear with each battle occurring in order as the often-bizarre story dictates.
title: Funky Fantasy

description:
Shinya Izayoi is not your average high-school student. He's knowledgeable in black magic, wears a ring that summons a magical sword, and is part of a group of students that investigates paranormal activity. Strange events such as spontaneous combustion have been happening recently, so Shinya and his (mostly cute and female) friends are drawn in to get to the truth of what's happening.

Nightruth is a visual novel-style adventure game following the adventures of a team of high school students who use their supernatural abilities to to investigate paranormal events. The game plays out as standard for this type of game, consisting of voiced and illustrated story scenes with occasional player choices; these choices branch off via player choice into one of three different storylines, each of which has multiple possible endings.

A music CD containing the game's theme song is also included in the package.
title: Nightruth: Explanation of the Paranormal #01 - "Yami no Tobira"

description:
Maria is the second game in the Nightruth series, following up after Yami no Tobira and this time focusing on one of the female leads, Maria Mizunagi, a fellow student of Shinya's who is skilled at fighting and possesses a supernatural healing ability.

Gameplay is identical to the visual novel-style adventure presentation of the previous title — voiced and illustrated story sequences which occasionally branch via player choice into multiple scenarios, each with multiple endings. This entry features stories relating to three famous historical events: Jack the Ripper, the Mary Celeste, and the Miracle of the Sun.
title: Nightruth: Explanation of the Paranormal - "Maria"

description: "Futatsu Dake no Shinjitsu" ("The Only Two Truths") is the third and final game in the Nightruth series, this time starring the youngest of Shinya's classmates, Ai Himekawa. The story focuses on her previously unexplained powers of precognition and telekinesis. Gameplay is again similar to the visual novel-style adventure presentation of the previous entries, featuring voiced and illustrated story sequences which occasionally branch via player choice into multiple endings. However, rather than featuring stories about famous supernatural phenomena, the focus this time is strictly on the main characters and their own personal stories.
title: Nightruth: Explanation of the Paranormal - "Futatsu Dake no Shinjitsu"

description: Ginga Eiyū Densetsu is a strategy simulation game, and part of a long-running series based on Yoshiki Tanaka's Legend of the Galactic Heroes science fiction novels. This console version is most similar to Ginga Eiyū Densetsu III, with the player taking the role of a top general in either the Galactic Empire or the Free Planets Alliance, commanding an entire fleet of ships. The game is divided into two main sections. In the strategy sections, the player is shown a full-scale map of the conflict, showing planets and the locations of ships; here the player may direct ships to move or engage with enemies, as well as converse with their officers. When battle starts, the player controls their fleet from a top-down perspective in semi realtime; each vessel can be given orders which they will carry out as instructed, but the action can also be paused at any point to issue new orders.
title: Ginga Eiyū Densetsu

description:
Dragon Force II: Kamisarishi Daichi ni is a real-time strategy and role-playing and the follow-up to Dragon Force. It is set 500 years after the events of the first game. The player follows a group of monarchs that come together to face a new threat looming over Legendra. The story also delves into what happened to the original Dragon Force after Madruk's defeat.

Compared to the first game it adds a laboratory system which lets the player research new skills. It also introduces the capacity to have two separate types of soldiers in the same army, thus allowing ground troops to be aided by air troops, for instance.
title: Dragon Force II: Kamisarishi Daichi ni

description:
In the Selecion Empire, the Grand Duchy of Mais is led by Alexis I. One day, his young son Alexis II visits an ancient temple, and is fascinated by a beautiful stone statue within. This statue is said to be of the goddess that protects Mais, but no records of her exist and she doesn't even have a name; the young Alexis II decides to give her a name himself. Not long after, the monster nation of Beaufon advances eastward toward Mais, and in the battle Alexis I loses his life. However, as Zaitan, one of the the Demon Generals of Beaufon, approaches the capital and all seems lost, a mysterious beautiful woman appears and defeats him with an inhuman strength. However, she has no memory of her past; she joins Alexis and Mais to fight against Beaufon and to find the meaning of her own existence, and so begins a fight for the fate of the world.

Terra Phantastica is a turn-based tactical strategy RPG in the vein of Tactics Ogre. The main game consists of battle sequences in which the player and the opposing forces commands numerous units around a grid-based map, moving and attacking enemies. Each unit consists of a leader and multiple soldiers, which can be arranged in various formations; soldiers can be lost as a unit is attacked, reducing its effectiveness and eventually eliminating that unit from the battle. Combat engagements between units can take multiple turns, with attacks, retreats, formation changes and other commands available on each turn turns. Between battles the player can consult with various other characters as well as arrange, equip, and train their units. Multiple endings are possible depending on the player's actions and the main character's relationship with Alexis II.
title: Terra Phantastica

description:
Funky Head Boxers is a slapstick boxing game adapted from the arcade game of the same title. This console conversion plays similar to the arcade version but includes significant changes and new content. Notably, the cast of boxers, originally consisting of Sega development staff, has largely been replaced with real-life comedians and actors represented by talent agency Yoshimoto Kogyo. This version includes a new "Champion Mode" in which the player selects a boxer and must train them to increase their stats by winning bouts. There is also a standard versus mode against either the computer or another player.

The Plus edition of the game, released several months later, includes the boss characters unlocked to play as by default and has various other minor polish but is otherwise identical to the original release.
title: Funky Head Boxers

description: This limited-edition release of Over Drivin' GT-R (a heavily localized version of The Need for Speed) includes the game along with a key holder designed to look like the Nissan S20 engine found in Skyline GT-R and Fairlady Z cars from the late 1960s and early 1970s.
title: Nissan Presents: Over Drivin' GT-R (Premium Pack)

description: This limited-edition release of Magic Carpet includes the game along with a Sega Multi Controller (also known as the 3D Control Pad outside Japan).
title: Magic Carpet (Tokubetsu Genteiban Sega Multi Controller Set)

alternate_titles.title: NiGHTS into Dreams... (Tokubetsu Genteiban Sega Multi Controller Set)

description: This release of NiGHTS into dreams... includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 3D Control Pad (also known as the Sega Multi Controller in Japan).
title: NiGHTS into Dreams... (with 3D Control Pad)

description: DeJig: Tin Toy is a digital jigsaw puzzle game and part of the DeJig series. The game includes 20 different puzzles featuring photographs of various 50s-style toy models, which come in both 72-piece and 108-piece difficulty levels. Pieces can be rotated and will lock into place when placed correctly, and the completed image can be viewed at any time as a reference. Completing each puzzle will unlock a bonus video of that particular toy, and there is also a movie mode where a playlist can be created of the available videos to view in sequence.
title: DeJig: Tin Toy

description: DeJig: Aqua World is a digital jigsaw puzzle game and part of the DeJig series. The game includes 20 different puzzles featuring photographs of various tropical fish, which come in both 72-piece and 108-piece difficulty levels. Pieces can be rotated and will lock into place when placed correctly, and the completed image can be viewed at any time as a reference. Completing each puzzle will unlock a bonus video of that specific fish, and there is also a movie mode where a playlist can be created of the available videos to view in sequence.
title: DeJig: Aqua World

description: DeJig: Lassen Art Collection is a digital jigsaw puzzle game and part of the DeJig series. The game includes 20 different puzzles featuring the works of marine artist Christian Riese Lassen, which come in 36-piece, 72-piece, and 108-piece difficulty levels, with the 36-piece puzzles being circular instead of rectangular. Pieces can be rotated and will lock into place when placed correctly, and the completed image can be viewed at any time as a reference. Completing each puzzle will unlock a high-quality version of that painting for view in a gallery mode.
title: DeJig: Lassen Art Collection

description: DeJig: McKnight Art Collection is a digital jigsaw puzzle game and part of the DeJig series. The game includes 20 different puzzles featuring the works of painter Thomas McKnight, which come in 72-piece and 108-piece difficulty levels. Pieces can be rotated and will lock into place when placed correctly, and the completed image can be viewed at any time as a reference. Completing each puzzle will unlock a high-quality version of that painting for view in a gallery mode.
title: DeJig: McKnight Art Collection

description: Dream Square is a multimedia fan disc featuring singer and actress Akiko Hinagata. It includes photo and video galleries of the idol and her music, interview clips, and various other bits of information, all presented as the player getting a personal tour of her house. There is also a puzzle mode where the player must unscramble photographs within a time limit. The package also includes a 1997–2001 calendar.
title: Dream Square: Hinagata Akiko

description: 2Tax Gold is a quiz game with a comedy theme. Unlike many quiz games, each question only has two choices, and the goal is to answer each question as quickly as possible. In the main story mode, wrong answers will penalize the player with a time loss by showing strange animations, and losing too much time will result in a game over. There is also an endless mode with two difficulty levels where the goal is to answer as many questions correctly in a row as possible.
title: 2Tax Gold

description: Zap! Snowboarding Trix is a snowboarding game endorsed by pro snowboarder Masao "Bubbles" Misawa. The game includes three single-player modes: Race Mode is an arcade-style race against a computer opponent; Practice Mode is a single-player time trial that records best times; and Free Mode is has no goals and removes the time limit. There are three courses, three boarders with different stats, and five computer difficulty levels.
title: Zap! Snowboarding Trix

description: K-1 Fighting Illusion Shō is a martial arts sports game licensed by the K-1 kickboxing promotion, featuring the likenesses of 12 real-life fighters from around the world. The game includes a single-player arcade mode against the computer, a two-player versus mode, a tournament mode for up to eight players, and a 3-on-3 team battle mode. There is also an AI Fighter mode where the player selects a fighter, adjusts their stats and moves, and can pit them against another AI fighter or a human player.
title: K-1 Fighting Illusion Shō

description: Roommate W: Futari is a love-simulation adventure game and part of the Roommate series. It takes place after the events of the previous games, featuring two new heroines who have moved in with the protagonist: Yūko Yamaguchi, a high school senior from Sendai; and Kaori Satō, a university nursing student from Shizuoka. The format is the same as previous games: the player can move around the apartment and speak with either of the girls, responding to their conversation via multiple choice prompts. As in the previous titles, in-game events are affected not just by the player's dialogue choices, but also by time and frequency of gameplay.
title: Roommate W: Futari

description:
Monster Slider is a falling-block puzzle game similar to Columns or Puyo Puyo. Colored blocks fall in pairs from the top of the screen and must be arranged to match 3 or more of the same color together. Uniquely the entire playfield is at a tilt, causing blocks to slide to one side to fill gaps when they are placed or after clearing other blocks; the player can reverse the tilt at any time, causing blocks to slide in the opposite direction. Combos will launch garbage blocks at the opposing player, and if the blocks reach the top of the well that player loses the round. Each character also has a unique special ability.

The main single-player story mode casts the player as a young woman named Nina whose sister has been kidnapped by Count Dracula; she must defeat each of Dracula's minions and eventually Dracula himself in order to rescue her. There is also a two-player versus mode and a single-player endless mode.
title: Monster Slider

description:
The player takes the role of the dragon Garpu, who finds himself trapped on a mysterious island, where he is required to learn to harness the power of the seven winds.

The gameplay consists of trekking across platforms, interacting with characters, finding various objects to use where needed, and completing set tasks. Talking to characters reveals vital information to progress in the game. The power of the seven winds can be used to bypass obstacles.
title: Nanatsu Kaze no Shima Monogatari

description:
A boy named Kerun lives a rather boring life. One night, he spots a shooting star in the sky and makes a wish, but winds up getting more than he bargained for! The star hears him and appears before him to grant his wish, and he's whisked away through a portal to the land of Paneltia, where he must take up a sword and become the hero of this fantastic realm.

Paneltia Story is a Japanese-style RPG with a twist: the world the player explores isn't fixed, but rather is constructed by the player as it is being explored. The player collects various "panels" representing different locations and types of terrain from enemies, item boxes, and shops; these can be placed on the map to create new areas to explore and find yet more panels. The game is divided up into stages, with the goal of each stage generally being to build up enough experience and strength to defeat a boss hidden somewhere in the map. Battles are turn-based affairs in the style of Dragon Quest, with the player controlling only the lone protagonist.
title: Paneltia Story: Kerun no Daibōken

description: Maboroshi no Black Bass is a cartoony fishing game set in a fantastical dream world. The player controls a young boy who meets a fairy in a dream, and is told that he won't be able to wake up and return to the real world until he catches the titular black bass. The main story mode is divided into stages, which each takes place in a different area and has a time limit and a specific target to catch. New lures, as well as hints and other information, can be purchased from a shop, and various special moves can even be used to assist the player in catching fish. The game also includes a simplified "Kids Mode" consisting of only three stages, meant to help fishing game beginners learn to play.
title: Maboroshi no Black Bass

description: Planet Joker is a vertically-scrolling shoot-em-up with a strong story presentation. A mysterious army has invaded Tokyo, and it's up to a special crack team of JSDF mech pilots to defeat the invaders. The player chooses from one of seven different mech suits, each of which has different stats and a different set of attack abilities. In addition to regular shots and bombs, there is also a charged shot, and three different weapon types which can be swapped and upgraded by collecting items throughout each of the seven stages. There are also two competition modes: a time-attack mode to reach a set score as quickly as possible, and a caravan-style score attack mode with a time limit.
title: Planet Joker

description: Amagi Shien is a murder-mystery adventure game featuring live actors. The player takes the role of an assistant to the famous detective-novelist-turned-real-detective Fumi Kindaichi, who has come to the remote Amagisō hot springs resort as it celebrates its 60th anniversary. Tensions are high with all of the resort's shareholders present, and it's not long before a body is found. It's up to the player to explore the grounds and solve the mystery, hopefully before anyone else winds up dead. The game's story is presented via live-action photos and video clips, with the player's actions and choices determining how the story proceeds, leading to one of over 30 different endings.
title: Amagi Shien

description:
Many years ago, explorers ventured deep into an underground cave in Iceland, where to their surprised they found living, breathing dinosaurs! The dinosaurs were brought to a tropical island for research, and the warm climate allowed them to breed and multiply. What's more, it was discovered that the dinosaurs could be controlled with the power of music, and soon a new profession arose, specifically to train and control dinosaurs through song. Twin sisters, Emily and Angie, have just enrolled at the dinosaur training academy in hopes of becoming great trainers.

Daina Airan is an interactive-comic adventure game from the creators of Yumimi Mix. The game includes animated scenes with voiceovers and music, occasionally asking the player to choose from several options, which will determine which scenes play out and what path the story takes.
title: Daina Airan

description:
Sankyo Fever S is pachinko simulation game, and the first in the Fever series to be released on the Saturn. It contains digital recreations of six real-life pachinko machines made by Sankyo: CR Fever Beach, Fever Nin Nin Emaki SP, CR Fever Big Powerful FX, Carrot Boy, Missile 7-7-6D, and Akudaman SP. There is no campaign or story mode, but each machine has various configuration and stat tracking options and can be freely played.

The limited-edition release includes six trading cards featuring photos of the included pachinko machines, but is otherwise identical.
title: Sankyo Fever S: Jikki Simulation

description: Sankyo Fever S Vol.2 is pachinko simulation game, and part of the Fever series. It contains digital recreations of three real-life pachinko machines made by Sankyo: CR Fever Pistol Daimyo SR, Fever Pistol Daimyo GP, and Fever Hanafuda GP; each can be freely played with various pin configurations. There is also a story mode where the player can pursue a relationship with one of two cute girls in between pachinko sessions.
title: Sankyo Fever S: Jikki Simulation Vol.2

description: Sankyo Fever S Vol.3 is pachinko simulation game, and part of the Fever series. It contains digital recreations of five real-life pachinko machines made by Sankyo: CR Fever Super Nine JX, Fever Magical Mumu-chan, Fever Powerful III, Fever Queen II, and Fever Big Chime. There is no campaign or story mode, but each machine has various configuration and stat tracking options and can be freely played.
title: Sankyo Fever: Jikki Simulation S Vol.3

description:
This double-pack bundles together two pachinko simulation games from the Sankyo Fever series:

  • Sankyo Fever S: Jikki Simulation Vol. 2
  • Sankyo Fever: Jikki Simulation S Vol. 3
title: Sankyo Fever: Jikki Simulation S Vol.3 (Bonus Pack)

description: Advanced World War is a turn-based war strategy game set during World War II. The campaign mode casts the player as a commander in the German Nazi army, participating in major battles of the real-life war. There is also a free battle mode for up to four players with 10 different map scenarios to choose from. While gameplay is a turn-based affair in the style of Daisenryaku, in addition to the hex-based ground map each mission also includes a square-based aerial map overlaid on top, allowing for combat interaction between ground and air units.
title: Advanced World War: Sennen Teikoku no Kōbō - Last of the Millennium

description: Sotsugyō S: Graduation is an enhanced port of the original Graduation. This version of the game includes a handful of new events and vocal music tracks, along with newly redrawn graphics. Also included in the package are a student notebook and a badge styled after the Seika Girls' High School emblem.
title: Sotsugyō S: Graduation

description: This Sega Saturn port of Sotsugyō Crossworld includes significant additional content over the original PlayStation release: there are new events and endings for five additional characters, meaning all 12 girls can now be dated in this version, and there is also a new original voice drama included.
title: Sotsugyō Crossworld

description: J.League Go Go Goal! is a soccer game licensed by the Japanese J.League organization and featuring all 17 clubs and full stats for the 1997 season. It includes standard league and exhibition modes and supports up to four simultaneous players. A notable feature of the game is the ability to create custom player formations, and the option to switch between multiple different play strategies on the fly during a match.
title: J.League Go Go Goal!

description:
In the near future, a system called "Virtuacall" allows for real-time group video calls. The player is a young man who signs up for the Virtuacall service in hopes of meeting women. These group chats each include three girls plus the player, with the player selecting dialogue choices and which girl to direct their attention to as the conversation proceeds, and it is possible to choose a girl to talk to one-on-one at certain points. Build enough trust and friendship with a girl and you'll eventually learn their phone number, and perhaps even get to meet them for a real-life date.

Virtuacall S is a modified conversion of the adult PC game Virtuacall 3. This version removes the explicit adult content, but adds three additional characters originally from Virtuacall 2.
title: Virtuacall S

description: This limited-edition release of Virtuacall S includes the game along with a so-called "Yobikake-kun" disc which includes data that allows the characters in the game to address the player by name. Data for 300 common names and 50 nicknames are present on the disc.
title: Virtuacall S (Shokai Gentei)

description: Digital Ange: Dennō Tenshi SS is a remake of Dennō Tenshi: Digital Ange. The story and gameplay are almost identical to the original release, with some minor story additions and higher-quality redrawn artwork. The most significant changes are that the characters have all been redesigned by a different illustrator in a new art style, and all the voice acting has been re-recorded with a different cast.
title: Digital Ange: Dennō Tenshi SS

description:
Cube Battler: Story of Shou is a competitive puzzle game with a strong emphasis on story and anime cutscenes, in which two players race to rotate and arrange cubes on a grid to match a video playing in the background. Each player can pick up cubes from the tray at the bottom, then rotate and place them into a 3x4 playfield; each player can also attack or defend at any time. Whichever player completes their puzzle first, or reduces their opponent's health to zero, wins the match.

This release is the first chapter of the story; it follows Debugger Shou, a game tester who enters the Cube Battle tournament looking to expose the wrongdoings of the game's developer.
title: Cube Battler: Story of Shou

description:
Cube Battler: Story of Anna is a competitive puzzle game where two players race to rotate and arrange cubes on a grid to match a video playing in the background. Each player can pick up cubes from the tray at the bottom, then rotate and place them into a 3x4 playfield; each player can also attack or defend at any time. Whichever player completes their puzzle first, or reduces their opponent's health to zero, wins the match.

This release is the second chapter of the story; it follows Anna Mirai, a young girl who enters the Cube Battle tournament in hopes of meeting a cool gamer boyfriend.
title: Cube Battler: Story of Anna

description: World Evolution Soccer is a soccer game featuring 32 national teams with no official league license. Three modes are included: a World Cup season mode, a single-match Exhibition mode, and a Party Mode for a four-team mini-tournament. A notable feature is the high level of team formation and strategy customization, allowing the player to tweak how the CPU controls their team's players; this can be adjusted not just before a game but also during breaks in a match.
title: World Evolution Soccer

description: Yūshun: Classic Road is a derby horse breeding and management simulation game and part of the Classic Road series. The player manages a stable of horses, breeding and training them, and entering them into races. The game offers the choice of any season from 1988 to 1996 including all the real-life horses active for each season, with the ultimate goal of winning the Classic to reach the prestigious G1 race. In addition to the campaign mode, there is also a competition mode for up to four players.
title: Yūshun: Classic Road

description: AI Igo is a digital conversion of the ancient Chinese board game Go, which uses a play algorithm originally developed by David Fotland for The Many Faces of Go. It offers play against four different levels of computer difficulty or a second player, the ability to save and resume games in progress, and options for 9x9, 13x13, and 19x19 game boards.
title: AI Igo

description: Top Anglers: Super Fishing Big Fight 2 is a fishing game and a sequel to Super Fishing Bigfight. The main mode is a series of four tournaments, each of which takes place in a different environment and has a specific type of target fish. There is also a free fishing mode where the player can select from each of the locations and choose a target fish, rod type, season, and time of day to freely fish that area.
title: Top Anglers: Super Fishing Big Fight 2

description: Daisenryaku: Strong Style is a hex-based war strategy game and part of the long-running Daisenryaku series. As usual for the franchise, the game includes ground, air, and naval units, and up to five armies can fight on a given map. There is both a campaign mode where the player selects from two different missions for each stage, as well as a single map mode with 16 different scenarios. In addition, the game includes a map editor, numerous assist options meant to ease in strategy game beginners, and even a unit model viewer.
title: Daisenryaku: Strong Style

description:
Kochira Katsushika-ku Kameari Kōen-mae Hashutsujo: Nakagawa Land Dai Race! no Maki is a digital multiplayer board game based on the anime and manga franchise known internationally as KochiKame: Tokyo Beat Cops. The game is set in a new amusement park owned by the Nakagawa Zaibatsu, divided into six themed areas.

Players take turns spinning a roulette to determine their move, and each space can contain various events including many popular side characters from the original comic. Players collect money and points which can be used in certain events to give one player an advantage, and the winner is the first player to reach the goal at the end of the board. Each of the six playable characters — Ryotsu, Nakagawa, Reiko, Honda, Volvo, and Maria — have different abilities and weaknesses. For example, Honda can ride a motorcycle to increase his movement range, while Maria can wear a Chinese dress to attack other characters with martial arts.
title: Kochira Katsushika-ku Kameari Kōen-mae Hashutsujo: Nakagawa Land Dai Race! no Maki

description:
Ten years ago, the elite officer Ovan was assigned to the president's security detail at his inauguration. Following a barely-averted assassination attempt, he attempts to track down the group responsible, but his plane is shot down and he's soon branded a traitor, wrongly accused of masterminding the attack. Forced to flee his home planet, Ovan becomes a mercenary and eventually finds and joins the group responsible for the assassination attempt, hoping to exact his revenge.

QuoVadis 2: Wakusei Kyōshū Ovan Rei ("The Ovan Rei Planet Assault") is a sci-fi realtime strategy game. It is the sequel to QuoVadis, though the gameplay is completely different and the story is largely unrelated despite taking place in the same universe. The player commands a squad of various primary and support units, with the primary interaction being simply to direct units around the map as they will attack automatically when within range of enemies. Each mission has specific objectives such as taking control of a location or protecting certain units from attack as they travel across the map, and between missions the player can configure the loadout and characteristics of each unit in detail according to the next mission's requirement.
title: QuoVadis 2: Wakusei Kyōshū Ovan Rei

description:
The year is 20XX, and the world has long been in a state of relative peace since the end of World War II. But with the sudden arrival of mysterious UFOs all over the world, that peace has been shattered. The invaders indiscriminately attack the armies of the world, forcing them to either submit or face destruction. A warship called the Ragoh, developed by the Japanese Navy during World War II using alien technology but never put into action before the war ended, is the world's only hope for salvation.

Shin Katei Gunkan: Kōtetsu no Kodoku is a sci-fi turn-based war strategy game based on the 1995 anime OVA series known internationally as Super Atragon. It is a hex-based game in the style of Daisenryaku, including land, air, and sea units but with a focus on naval combat as the player's main unit is a Navy warship. The player commands the Ragoh and its supporting units, assisting international UN forces around the world against the Atlantean invaders. The game is divided into a linear series of missions, and before each mission the player gets advisement from their crew and can adjust their units' stats and loadouts.
title: Shin Katei Gunkan: Kōtetsu no Kodoku

description:
Saturn Music School is an educational game that teaches the basics of playing the piano. It includes a multi-stage tutorial mode, 20 popular songs to play along with, and a composition mode where the player can write their own music. There are also several mini-games included: the first tasks the player with repeating notes as they're played; the second tasks the player with repeating a sequence of notes; and the third is a quiz that asks basic questions about music.

The package includes an adapter to connect a standard MIDI keyboard (not included), which is required to play the game.
title: Saturn Music School

description: This deluxe edition of Saturn Music School includes the game along with a MIDI keyboard and MIDI adapter to connect it to the Sega Saturn.
title: Saturn Music School (MIDI Keyboard Dōkon Special Pack)

description: Saturn Music School 2 is a follow-up to Saturn Music School which includes 30 new songs to play piano along with. It also includes the same selection of tutorial modes and composition tool as the first game. The package includes an adapter to connect a standard MIDI keyboard (not included), which is required to play the game.
title: Saturn Music School 2

description:
Kengo is an average guy working at a video rental store. One day, his boss asks him to make an ad for recruiting female employees for the store, hoping that a cute face at the counter might help business. While Kengo is working on the ad on his computer, a cute girl suddenly appears on the screen; this rather flustered and excitable young lady introduces herself as Panic, and before long she appears in the real world and starts working at the video store. However, while she might attract customers, she also attracts trouble, and soon another mysterious lady starts appearing on video screens. Just who are these two girls, and what is their connection?

Panic-chan is a visual-novel style adventure game with a focus on animated sequences; it describes itself as an "OVA adventure" and includes 90 minutes of original animation. Most of the game proceeds in a linear format, with each scene playing out through dialogue and animation; there are occasionally choices of which action the protagonist should take, which will branch the story and lead to different scenes.
title: Panic-chan

description:
This limited-edition release of Panic-chan includes the game along with several bonus items:

  • A pair of enamel pins featuring Panic and Trouble
  • A mini-CD single containing the game's opening and ending themes plus a message from voice actresses Miwa Yanagihara (Panic) and Miki Nagasawa (Trouble)
  • A cardboard dress-up set featuring Panic and Trouble with 10 different outfits
title: Panic-chan (Genteiban)

description: Go III Professional: Taikyoku Igo is a digital conversion of the ancient Chinese board game Go, part of a series of such games produced by Oxford Softworks. Like the previous release, this version offers play against 12 different CPU skill levels or a second player, options for 9x9, 13x13, and 19x19 game boards, handicap options, Chinese or Japanese rule variations, and a variety of board graphic options. New in this version is the option to set turn time limits for each player.
title: Go III Professional: Taikyoku Igo

description: This special release of Puzzle Bobble 3 is modified to exclusively support online multiplayer functionality via the Sega Saturn Modem and XBand service. Released at a lower price, most of the single-player content has been removed from this version, with only a short demo of the standard puzzle mode available for offline play.
title: Puzzle Bobble 3 for SegaNet

description: This special release of Puyo Puyo Sun is modified to exclusively support online multiplayer functionality via the Sega Saturn Modem and XBand service. Released at a lower price, most of the single-player content has been removed from this version, with only the single-player endless mode available for offline play.
title: Puyo Puyo Sun for SegaNet

description:
One day, a mysterious old woman presents a young boy with a deck of Tarot cards. Examining them transports the boy to a fantasy realm where adventure awaits.

Arcana Strikes is a role-playing game with a strong focus on collecting cards to battle various opponents.
title: Arcana Strikes

description:
Dezaemon 2 is a game creation kit that allows the player to construct their own custom scrolling shooter. While fundamentally quite similar to the previous release in the series, this Saturn edition includes several notable new features and improvements. The major new feature is the ability to create horizontal shooting games in addition to vertical, and games can now include as many as 10 stages. All the prior tools including the stage, graphic, and music editors are present with improvements, and a new tool allows the user to easily create sprites by manipulating 3D models rather than drawing graphics pixel-by-pixel.

Included in the package are a total of five sample games, two of which are hidden behind secret codes: Biometal Gust and Vexsarsion Miyabi demonstrate the horizontal game construction capabilities, while Ramsie, Daioh P!, and Elfin are vertical shooter samples.
title: Dezaemon 2

description: This limited-edition release of Tokimeki Memorial: Forever with You includes the game along with a Backup Memory Cartridge and a binder, in addition to the calendar and set of trading cards also included with the standard release.
title: Tokimeki Memorial: Forever with You (Special-ban)

description: The Star Bowling is a 3D bowling game where the player competes against one of five real-life voice actresses. The main story mode has the player select a girl and play against them in multiple games; winning against each opponent will unlock video clips of that girl in a bonus gallery on the second disc. Various ball and lane variations are included, and there is also a two-player versus mode.
title: The Star Bowling

description: The Star Bowling Vol. 2 directly expands on the first game's concept, providing five more real-life actresses to bowl with. As before, winning against each girl will unlock video clips of them, and there are multiple ball and lane types to choose from. New in this edition is a trial mode where the player must clear a sequence of pin setups with a limited number of balls, and the multiplayer mode now supports up to four players.
title: The Star Bowling Vol. 2

description:
Kaitō Saint Tail is an RPG-style adventure game based on the manga and anime series of the same title created by Megumi Tachikawa. It follows the exploits of middle-schooler Meimi Haneoka, secretly also the master thief and vigilante Saint Tail, who steals illegitimately stolen items to return them to their rightful owners.

Gameplay is generally split between top-down exploration sections, visual-novel style dialogue sections, and various mini-games such as a falling-block puzzle game. While the exploration sections resemble a traditional Japanese-style RPG, there is no combat or experience points and limited use of items and money. Most of the gameplay consists of exploring the town and talking to other characters; major scenes will switch to a more detailed visual-novel style view that includes illustrations of the characters, with important scenes getting full-screen illustrations. During school events or in place of battle, various mini-games appear, with progression tied to successfully defeating the opponent.
title: Kaitō Saint Tail

description:
The third game of the Zero Divide series has been released exclusively in Japan on Sega Saturn. The hackers behind the XTAL Tower database have been cleared of all charges. However, the maverick XTAL AI remains a threat. The players who were part of the offensive program have been called upon to rid the world of this cyber menace for good.

The game can be played in Single Player Mode, Versus Mode against a second player or CPU, Training Mode for practice, Time Attack for matches under pressure, or Story Mode. The game has 10 playable characters, and 3 unlockable secret characters. Like the previous games, the game incorporates the armor breaking mechanic, so if a limb of an opponent is damaged enough, it becomes inoperable.
title: Zero Divide: The Final Conflict

description: Honkaku Shōgi Shinan: Wakamatsu Shōgi Juku is a shogi game featuring the endorsement of professional shogi player Masakazu Wakamatsu. In addition to a standard play mode for one or two players, it includes a variety of features and modes designed to help beginner shogi players improve their skills. There is a "cram school" mode where the player's skills are first measured, and then the game provides advice and challenges meant to help the player practice their weakest points. There is also a "tsumeshogi" shogi puzzle mode with three levels of difficulty, a "3-on-1" mode where the player must defeat three different opponents under specific restrictions, and even a "blind shogi" mode the player is only shown moves as they are made, and must remember the layout of the board.
title: Honkaku Shōgi Shinan: Wakamatsu Shōgi Juku

description: Pachi-Slot Kanzen Kōryaku: Uni-Colle '97 is a pachi-slot (Japanese slot machine) simulation game featuring digital recreations of eight real-life pachi-slot machines made by Universal and its subsidiaries: Baby Angel 2, Getter Mouse, Frozen Nights, Taco Slot, CC Angel, Dunk Shoot 2, Super Mog Mog 2, and Cranky Condor. Each machine is faithfully recreated, and the player can choose from six different manufacturer's settings to practice various configurations. The game includes detailed stat tracking for each machine.
title: Pachi-Slot Kanzen Kōryaku: Uni-Colle '97

description: Ō-sama Game is a game in which the player challenges various young women to simple games, and if the girl loses they must do whatever the player asks. There are three different mini-games, selected at random by a roulette: a rock-paper-scissors-style game where the losing player must react quickly to block an attack; a flags-style game where the player must push buttons according to an announcer's instructions; and a simple action game where the player must climb a bamboo shoot while avoiding falling objects. Upon winning a game, the player can select from a list of actions they can force the girl to do, such as "go for a swim" or "take a shower", and watch a video clip of them doing as ordered. There are eight girls to challenge, each of whom has numerous different situations and video clips to see.
title: Ō-sama Game

description: This limited edition release of Lovely Pop 2 in 1: Jang Jang Koi Shimasho includes the game along with a two-track audio CD that contains the game's opening and ending theme songs.
title: Lovely Pop 2 in 1: Jang Jang Koi Shimasho (Genteiban)

description:
Jantei: Battle Cos-Player is a 4-way riichi mahjong game featuring a science-fiction story and a combination of live-action and animated opponents. Set in a futuristic city where the greatest treasures are the costumes of a previous era, the player and their partner Yuko Saionji challenge a series of opponents to mahjong matches in order to collect as many costumes as possible and become the "Jantei", or Mahjong Emperor. Defeating opponents will award their costume, which Yuko can wear and show off in animated or live-action videos depending on which type of costume it is.

In addition to the main story mode, there is also a free battle mode. There is also a "making-of" disc included in the package, which contains a photo gallery and cast interview videos.
title: Jantei: Battle Cos-Player

description: Kidō Senkan Nadesico: Yappari Saigo wa "Ai ga Katsu"? is a love adventure game based on the Martian Successor Nadesico anime series. It consists of eight chapters, which each contain an adventure segment and a battle segment. The adventure segments play in standard Japanese adventure style, with the player able to move to different parts of the ship and speak with the various characters via menu commands; a major element is building Akito's relationship with each of 10 different love interests, and if their affection is high enough it's possible to invite them to a date at the ship's virtual room. The battle segments consist of simple ship-to-ship combat, with the player repeating button sequences shown on the screen to launch attacks. The other characters help during these sequences, and their affection level with Akito will also affect their effectiveness in battle.
title: Kidō Senkan Nadesico: Yappari Saigo wa "Ai ga Katsu"?

description: Kidō Senkan Nadesico: The Blank of 3 Years is a sound novel-style adventure game based on the Martian Successor Nadesico anime series. As the name suggests, it describes the events that occur in the in-universe three years between the TV series and the later movie. Gameplay consists of text descriptions of events over full-screen illustrations, with fully-voiced character dialogue. There are occasional choices presented which affect how certain scenes play out, but do not affect the overall progression of the story.
title: Kidō Senkan Nadesico: The Blank of 3 Years

description:
Bōken Katsugeki Mono Mono is a roguelike RPG in the style of Mysterious Dungeon, with a focus on collecting various kinds of items. The main character is a young boy named Gen, a trainee ninja living with his grandfather. His friend Yuki, the daughter of the village chief, has just fallen ill. In order to find the medicine needed to save her, Gen seeks the aid of the mysterious Mono Mono and enters a strange cave near the village, which is said to change its shape every time someone enters.

The focus of the game is on exploring the dungeon to collect various kinds of items, which can be used in and out of battle to assist Gen on his adventure. In addition to more traditional consumable items and equipment, Gen can also acquire costumes that completely change his battle abilities. Combat against monsters is 1-on-1 in a semi-automated side-view action format.
title: Bōken Katsugeki Mono Mono

description:
Fully Cowled Mini Yonku: Super Factory is a racing management simulation game based on the Mini Yonku (Mini 4WD) line of toy cars produced by Tamiya and featuring characters from the Bakusō Kyōdai Let's & Go!! manga and anime by Tetsuhiro Koshita. In the main race mode, one or more players selects a car and a track, tunes 14 parts of their car based on a wide range of options, and then watches the race play out between a field of five computer-controlled racers. There is no direct control over the vehicles by the player. Up to five players can compete at once, and the game also includes a track editor.

This Special Limited Edition is the only release of the game, and includes a Gunbluster XTO Metallic Blue car model body plus a "Special Mini Book".
title: Fully Cowled Mini Yonku: Super Factory (Special Limited Edition)

description: Savaki is a 3D one-on-one fighting game for one or two players which aims to recreate various martial arts in a realistic way. There are seven fighters to choose from, each representing a particular martial art, such as boxing, muay thai, or taekwando. Three game modes are included: a single-player arcade mode, a two-player versus mode, and a practice mode. There is no story mode, and only a single arena to fight in.
title: Savaki

description: Pro Yakyū Team mo Tsukurō! ("Let's Make a Pro Baseball Team, Too!") is baseball management simulation game spun off from Sega's better-known soccer management series. Selecting one of the 12 teams from the Japanese professional leagues, the goal is to build that team into the greatest baseball team in the world. Many aspects of managing a team are simulated and under control of the player, from hiring players and staff, determining training schedules and strategies before games, to even managing the team's finances and constructing facilities. The player can also create multiple custom players to sign to their team and train, and it is also possible to host an exhibition match against another player's team using a password function.
title: Pro Yakyū Team mo Tsukurō!

description: Umanari 1 Furlong Theater is a cartoon-style race horse breeding & management simulation game based on a manga by Miho Yoshida, one of several produced by Micro Vision. The player can breed horses and hire jockeys, determine training schedules, and enter their horses into races; races are computer-controlled but can be watched by the player with a running commentary. The game features a cartoony visual style, and a particularly unique feature is the ability to directly speak with the horses; as cartoon characters, they are able to talk, which lets the player ask them directly about their condition.
title: Umanari 1 Furlong Theater

description: Shutsudō! Mini-skirt Police is a mini-game collection and multimedia fan disc based on the TV variety program of the same title that ran on TV Tokyo between 1996 and 2005. There are five simple games in the package: a low-rider hydraulics competition, a top-down driving game where the player must avoid obstacles, a Breakout-style brick-breaker game, a vertical shooting game, and a card-matching memory game. All five games are themed around catching a glimpse of the titular characters' underwear. There are also two quiz games, a photo gallery, and numerous video clips of the actresses both in and out of uniform.
title: Shutsudō! Mini-skirt Police

description: This limited-edition release of Shutsudō! Mini-skirt Police includes the game along with a plastic character figurine and a "Star Festival" music CD single.
title: Shutsudō! Mini-skirt Police (Shokai Gentei Double Tokuten)

description:
Mahō Shōjo Pretty Sammy: "Osorubeshi Shintai Sokutei! Kakubakuhatsu 5-byō Mae!!" is a visual novel style adventure game based on the Magical Girl Pretty Sammy anime series. A mysterious woman named Shizuka has appeared as the new nurse at Sasami's school, and when a new Love-Love Monster appears during the school's annual student health exam, it's up to Pretty Sammy to stop it and save the day. The bulk of the gameplay consists of voiced story sequences over still images; the player is occasionally given a choice of which action to take in a scene, which will affect how the rest of the scene plays out but not the overall story as a whole.

Also included in the package is an audio mini-CD containing three music tracks.
title: Mahō Shōjo Pretty Sammy: "Osorubeshi Shintai Sokutei! Kakubakuhatsu 5-byō Mae!!"

description: Mahō Shōjo Pretty Sammy: Heart no Kimochi is a visual novel style adventure game based on the Magical Girl Pretty Sammy anime series. It includes two new original story episodes: the first involves a mysterious group creating a new kind of super-weapon, while the second revolves around the cast preparing chocolates for Valentine's Day. Gameplay is identical to the previous title: voiced dialogue sequences over still images drive the story, and the player is occasionally given a choice of which action to take in a scene; these choices will affect how the rest of the scene plays out but not the overall story progression.
title: Mahō Shōjo Pretty Sammy: Heart no Kimochi

description:
In the year 2099, an excavation somewhere in China inadvertently releases an ancient evil dragon that had been sealed within the Earth, which starts causing disaster all over the world. A man named Ken has come to China hoping to learn more about the dragons, and along with his companions, must seek the aid of the eight legendary dragons of China in order to once again seal the evil dragon and stop the destruction of the Earth.

Ryūteki Gosennen: Dragons of China is a Japanese-style adventure game broken into chapters. The player can visit various locations to talk with different characters and obtain information, with the story generally proceeding automatically once the proper actions have been selected. There are also simple battle sequences which can occur at certain points; interaction in these battles is limited to selecting which of the three characters in the party should attempt and attack.
title: Ryūteki Gosennen: Dragons of China

description: This limited-edition release of Mahjong Gakuensai includes the game along with a bonus disc containing interviews with the voice cast.
title: Mahjong Gakuensai (Shokai Genteiban)

description: Mahjong Gakuensai DX is a strip-mahjong game with a high school festival theme, and part of the Mahjong Gakuensai series. It is a remixed conversion of the first and second arcade releases, including a mix of opponents and locations found in both prior games. It is set on the day before the school festival, and the player is once again cast as a student hoping to get photos of his female classmates. Gameplay is the same as every other entry in the series, with the player visiting locations around campus and challenging other students in hopes of getting saucy photos of them. More impressive mahjong hands will raise a girl's "Mecha-Moe" gauge, resulting in more revealing photos the higher it gets, though this console version is censored and does not include any actual nudity. This version also includes a free-battle mode, various game rule options, and new animated opening and ending cutscenes.
title: Mahjong Gakuensai DX: Zenjitsu ni Matsuwaru Funsenki

description:
Kidō Senshi Z-Gundam (Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam) is an episodic side-scrolling action game based on the 1985 animated TV show of the same title. It is a direct adaptation of the TV series, including numerous clips from the show at key points in the story. This first part adapts the first half of the series, following protagonist Kamille Bidan, a young Gundam pilot for the AEUG rebel group fighting against corrupt Earth Federation forces.

The game is very similar to the first Gundam title for the Saturn, and includes two main modes of play: ground-based run-and-gun shooting, and space-flight shooting where the player can move freely around the screen. Waves of enemies appear on each stage, sometimes from the foreground or background, and the player earns experience for destroying them; pilot level affects both available combat abilities as well as certain story and character events, and can be carried over into the second part of the game.
title: Kidō Senshi Z-Gundam: Zenpen - Zeta no Kodō

description:
Kidō Senshi Z-Gundam (Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam) is an episodic side-scrolling action game based on the 1985 animated TV show of the same title. It is a direct adaptation of the TV series, including numerous clips from the show at key points in the story. This second part picks up directly after the events of the previous game, adapting the latter half of the series starting from the aftermath of the Gryps Conflict.

The game is very similar to the first Gundam title for the Saturn, and includes two main modes of play: ground-based run-and-gun shooting, and space-flight shooting where the player can move freely around the screen. Waves of enemies appear on each stage, sometimes from the foreground or background, and the player earns experience for destroying them; pilot level affects both available combat abilities as well as certain story and character events, and can be carried over from the previous game.
title: Kidō Senshi Z-Gundam: Kōhen - Sora o Kakeru

description:
Wara² Wars: Gekitō! Daigundan Battle is a turn-based board-game style war strategy game in which multiple factions attempt to conquer and unify all territory on a map. The player selects one of ten nations, and must conquer each continent over a series of maps. The two key features of the game are its focus on streamlined, simplified strategy with only a bare minimum of stats and commands to keep track of, and the large-scale battle scenes where up to 100 units on either side can participate.

Each turn, the player first collects taxes and pays their army, then can use remaining money to hire additional units and purchase special cards which have helpful effects, such as boosting offensive or defensive strength or summon powerful creatures in battle. The player then has five actions to spend each turn, including moving a squad between locations, strengthening a particular squad's offense or defense, or using one of their cards. Increasing units' levels will increase their strength, and grant a special ability at max level. Each nation has their own set of unit types, and conquering a nation's capital allows the player to add that nation's unique units to their own army.
title: Wara² Wars: Gekitō! Daigundan Battle

description: This limited edition release of Taiheiyō no Arashi 2: Shippū no Mōdō includes the game along with a "3D Weapon Data Collection" information disc, plus a replica military handbook and draft notice.
title: Taiheiyō no Arashi 2: Shippū no Mōdō (Shokai Gentei Premium Box)

description:
Koden Kōreijutsu: Hyaku Monogatari - Honto ni Atta Kowai Hanashi is a sound novel horror game based on stories from the Honto ni Atta Kowai Hanashi ("True Scary Stories") ghost story magazine published by Asahi Sonorama. It is hosted by famed ghost story presenter Junji Inagawa and is a sequel to the first Hyaku Monogatari game. Very similar to the first game, it presents the player with 100 candles, which each represents an individual ghost story for the player to experience.

Most of the stories are short and non-interactive sound novel sequences; several are presented as video sequences, while a handful include interactive elements where the player explores a location in first-person to move the story forward. The stories are presented in a fixed order, regardless of which candle the player selects, with a few recurring character between them. There are also certain special events that will only occur at particular times of day, usually late at night.
title: Koden Kōreijutsu: Hyaku Monogatari - Honto ni Atta Kowai Hanashi

description:
High-school student Shingo Kashiwara is spending his summer vacation at a beach town, and it just so happens that three girls from his school — all of them cute and single — are also staying at the same lodging. He decides it's the perfect chance to get to know them, and perhaps even make his move on the girl of his dreams.

Beach de Reach! is a riichi mahjong game combined with a simple love adventure game. The player's affection level with each of the three girls is affected not just by the interactions in the adventure sequences — the girls will react to the player's choices at specific points, and it is also possible to gift special items which can raise the affection level and trigger special event if the right item is picked for the right girl — but also by the player's performance in the mahjong sequences. While it's important to show your skills, the best move in mahjong may not be the best move in wooing a girl, and it may sometimes be prudent to let your favored lady win a few rounds here and there.

In addition to the main story mode, the game also includes a free battle mode with a variety of game rule settings, as well as a "mahjong school" quiz mode to test the player's basic knowledge of mahjong.
title: Beach de Reach!

description: This deluxe release of Game Tengoku includes the game along with a VHS tape which contains an original animated short (16 minutes) and voice cast interviews (41 minutes).
title: Game Tengoku: The Game Paradise! (Gokuraku Pack)

description: This release of Metal Slug includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: Metal Slug (Okaidoku Set)

description: This release of Groove on Fight includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: Groove on Fight: Gōketsuji Ichizoku 3 (Kakuchō RAM Cartridge Tsuki!)

description: This release of Waku Waku 7 includes the game along with a Sega Saturn 1MB RAM Expansion Cartridge.
title: Waku Waku 7 (Okaidoku Set)

description:
This bundle packages two games from Koei's Nobunaga's Ambition series together in an oversized box:

  • Nobunaga no Yabō: Tenshōki
  • Nobunaga no Yabō Returns
title: Value Set Series: Nobunaga no Yabō Tenshōki & Nobunaga no Yabō Returns

description:
This bundle packages two games from Koei's Romance of the Three Kingdoms series together in an oversized box:

  • Sangokushi V
  • Sangokushi Returns
title: Value Set Series: Sangokushi V & Sangokushi Returns

description:
This bundle packages together two first-person adventure games in an oversized box:

  • Nanatsu no Hikan
  • Myst
title: Adventure Pack: Nanatsu no Hikan & Myst

description:
