The Japanese version of the SegaSaturn Modem accessory was sold with several different software packages throughout its life. The original release in July 1996 included the following software, none of which was ever available for purchase separately:

  • SegaSaturn Internet Vol.1, an internet web browser application.
  • Pad Nifty, a bulletin-board application that let the user browse special Sega Saturn message boards.
  • A special version of Virtua Fighter Remix which allows for online play.

Two other packages were later released, which each include an upgraded version of the web browser software and an additional game for online play:

  • Cyber Troopers Virtual On for SegaNet, included in a December 1996 package. This version of the game was also available separately.
  • DecAthlete for SegaNet, included in a 1997 anniversary package. This version of the game was not available separately.

All three games which were included in the various packages were modified from their standard retail releases, both to add the networked multiplayer functions, as well as to remove all offline/single-player content. As such, none will work without a functional modem and SegaNet service.
title: SegaSaturn Modem (included games)

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.1: Kinoshita Yū is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Yū Kinoshita. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips of the idol, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame. Winning three rounds of the minigame will unlock a bonus video.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.1: Kinoshita Yū

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.2: Uchiyama Miki is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Miki Uchiyama. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips of the idol, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame. Winning three rounds of the minigame will unlock a bonus video.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.2: Uchiyama Miki

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.3: Ōshima Akemi is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Akemi Ōshima. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips of the idol, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame. Winning three rounds of the minigame will unlock a bonus video.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.3: Ōshima Akemi

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.4: Kuroda Mirei is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Mirei Kuroda. It includes a gallery of photos and interview questions, as well as a simple quiz minigame with questions about the idol. Clearing all rounds of the quiz will give the player a password and instructions to enter a prize drawing with publisher SadaSoft.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.4: Kuroda Mirei

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.5: Fujisaki Nanako is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Nanako Fujisaki. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips of the idol, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will give the player passwords to unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.5: Fujisaki Nanako

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.6: Yoshida Satomi is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Satomi Yoshida. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.6: Yoshida Satomi

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.7: Asō Kaori is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Kaori Asō. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.7: Asō Kaori

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.8: Furukawa Emiko is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Emiko Furukawa. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.8: Furukawa Emiko

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.9: Nagamatsu Keiko is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Keiko Nagamatsu. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.9: Nagamatsu Keiko

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.10: Masaki Mai is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Mai Masaki. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.10: Masaki Mai

description: Private Idol Disc Vol.11: Hirose Mayumi is a multimedia photobook of gravure idol Mayumi Hirose. It includes a gallery of photos and video interviews, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors minigame and a quiz minigame. Completing the minigames will unlock bonus photos.
title: Private Idol Disc Vol.11: Hirose Mayumi

description: Private Idol Disc Tokubetsuhen: Cosplayers is a multimedia photobook of female cosplayers. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips, as well as a simple rock-paper-scissors style minigame themed like a 1-on-1 fighting game. Winning the minigame will unlock bonus videos.
title: Private Idol Disc Tokubetsuhen: Cosplayers

description: Private Idol Disc Tokubetsuhen: Can Gal '97 is a multimedia photobook of so-called "campaign girls", who are models who appear in advertising and corporate promotion. It includes a gallery of photos and video clips of 18 girls, as well as a quiz minigame with 10 questions. There is no bonus reward for completing the minigame.
title: Private Idol Disc Tokubetsuhen: Can Gal '97

description:
Cubic Gallery: Edy & Disy is a first-person adventure edutainment game about art history. The detective Edy and his assistant Disy are visiting an art museum when suddenly they hear the Mona Lisa calling out for help, and find themselves pulled into the world of the painting. She explains that her tears have been lost and scattered among the paintings in the museum, and it's up to our heroes to find and recover them.

The player is given text hints as to which paintings might contain a tear, and must find them amongst the more than 50 famous paintings featured. Each painting also includes detailed history and information the player can to read to learn more. The game is packaged with two coupons for a discount on entry to the Hakone Open-Air Museum in Hakone, Kanagawa, Japan.
title: Cubic Gallery: Edy & Disy

description:
Good Island Cafe is an interactive multimedia game starring actress and media personality Ai Iijima. The player takes the part of a new director tasked with producing promotional materials for Ai's newest music single: a music video, an interview, a photo gallery for her fan club, and a promotional video clip.

The music video and promo clip have the player switching between four cameras to get the best shot; the interview lets the player choose between two questions to ask in each segment; and the photo shoot has the player taking snapshots from a beach side video. It's possible for Ai to walk off the set if she doesn't like the shots chosen, forcing the player to start that sequence over. A special video can only be unlocked if Ai is satisfied with your performance in all four sections.
title: Ai Iijima Interactive Video Clip: Good Island Cafe

description:
Neon Genesis Evangelion: Digital Card Library is a fan disc and minigame collection based on the 1995 anime series. The game contains many dozens of "digital trading cards" to collect and browse, which mostly contain various short video clips of the show; some also contain episode previews, merchandise photos, original mini-comics, or additional minigames. Completing the games will unlock additional cards and games to play.

There are a total of nine different minigames, including an Evangelion trivia quiz, a Simon-says type game where the player must remember the direction of light flashes on Gendo's glasses, and a maze game where Shinji must get beer for Misato from vending machines.
title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Digital Card Library

description: Tactics Formula is an F1 racing simulation board game for up to four players. Rather than driving a course in real-time, the player instead selects the route to take for each section of track from preset points laid out on a map, keeping in mind race conditions such as the position of other vehicles, tire durability, and remaining fuel. After deciding the route for a section, the choices made play out and the player then plans the next section's route, continuing until completing the race. A real-time replay of the full race is shown once the race is complete. There are a total of 16 different tracks to race.
title: Tactics Formula

description: GVector is a sci-fi chase-view rail shooter in the style of Panzer Dragoon. The player pilots a small fighter craft and must fight off an alien invasion of Earth. There are two weapons at the player's disposal: a standard foward shot, and a homing laser that can lock on to up to eight targets; the more targets locked and destroyed simultaneously, the greater the bonus points awarded. There are a total of six stages, each with an encounter with a large boss enemy at the end, and the game includes a standard story mode as well as a score attack mode where any stage previously completed can be played and practiced for high scores.
title: GVector

description: Momotarō Dōchūki is a multiplayer board-game and a spinoff of Hudson's Momotarō Dentetsu series. It features many of the same characters and gameplay elements as the main series games, but with a new setting in the Edo period of Japanese history. As with other Momotetsu games, players take turns moving around the board via dice rolls, acquiring property to earn money, trying to avoid giving money to other players, and encountering a wide variety of random (and often comical) events that can grant each player various benefits or handicaps.
title: Momotarō Dōchūki

description:
Tactical Fighter is a raising simulation game in the vein of Graduation, in which the player coaches a teenage girl to become a skilled fighter. 15-year-old Hitomi Sakaki is training as a martial artist in hopes of discovering the whereabouts of her missing father. The player must decide Hitomi's schedule for each week, both what she should do each day — train her fighting skills, work a part-time job, attend classes, or simply take a day off to rest — as well as what her diet should be.

There are various characters to challenge in battle, though the fights are largely automated with the player's influence limited to telling Hitomi when to guard or use a special move. There is an underground fighting tournament held annually, and the ultimate goal of the game is to train Hitomi to win the tournament within three years.
title: Tactical Fighter

description: Ochige Designer: Tsukutte Pon! is a game creation tool that lets the player make their own customized falling-block puzzle game. It is possible to customize the game rules, including how pieces are cleared, as well as the well size and orientation, piece and character graphics, and even the title screen. Various rule sets are available, in the style of games including Tetris, Columns, Puyo Puyo, and Panic Bomber. There are six different sample games included in the package, which demonstrate the tool's various features and configuration options.
title: Ochige Designer: Tsukutte Pon!

description: Lupin the 3rd Chronicles is a database fan disc featuring a library of video clips, character information, and music from the Lupin the 3rd anime franchise. Included in the game is a so-called "Lupin Maniac Quiz", which contains numerous questions about the Lupin anime series. If the player can correctly answer 10 questions in a row, they'll be rewarded with a bonus video clip. Three different packages were released with different cover illustrations, but the contents are identical between all three.
title: Lupin the 3rd Chronicles

description: Ninpen Manmaru is a 3D action platform game based on the anime and manga known internationally as Manmaru the Ninja Penguin. The story is simple: Manmaru has been sent by his master to train on his own and hone his ninja skills, and his rivals show up to try and thwart him. The game is broken into six themed stages, which each consists of four areas and a boss fight. Each area is a relatively compact area, and the objective is simply to find and reach the goal while collecting coins and avoiding enemies. Boss fights do not involve direct combat, but are instead various competitive minigames, such as a race to collect more coins than the opponent or to be the first to find the exit to a maze.
title: Ninpen Manmaru

description:
Hop Step Idol is a management simulation game in the vein of Graduation, where the player is the producer of a new boys idol group and must lead them to success. The game starts with the player recruiting each of the band members by visiting various locations around Tokyo; once the group is assembled, the simulation gameplay starts. The player must decide on each member's practice and work schedule for each week, keeping in mind their strengths and energy levels.

There are 10 different kinds of training, which each affect the eight parameters in various ways, and it's also important to keep drama between band members in check as their personalities will tend to clash. Different parameters improve skill at different jobs, including recording, concerts, and interviews. It is also possible to ask the boys out on dates, which can dramatically improve their motivation levels but may cause drama with their bandmates.
title: Hop Step Idol

description: Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers - Akuma Zensho Dai-ni-shū is a monster database and sound gallery fan disc for Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers. It also includes a short sound-novel style prologue scenario not found in the main game, which is a linear visual novel that takes around an hour to complete.
title: Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers - Akuma Zensho Dai-ni-shū

description: Gaia Breeder is a life-simulation sandbox game where the player attempts to recreate a natural environment. In the 23rd century, a meteor has wiped out all wild animal life on Earth, and humanity has decided to attempt to restore it using science. Using a time machine and a curious pink creature called "Mupi", the player travels back in time to harvest the DNA of extinct animals, then can clone or combine them in the present day. The game is divided into a series of "Breeder Tournaments" where the goal is to build a balanced and sustainable natural environment that can be used as a blueprint for restoring nature.
title: Gaia Breeder

description: DJ Wars is a rhythm game which simulates the experience of performing as a club DJ. The player is given control of two turntables, a mixing desk, and a variety of effects and scratches, and must select a sequence of tracks and mix between them to get the crowd dancing and excited. The main story mode lets the player choose from one of five DJs, each with their own signature tracks and preferred music styles, and must perform at each of the nine clubs in the city. Skilled performance and track selections that match the clientele's tastes will reward the player with higher marks, and the ultimate goal is to play at the biggest club in the city. There is also a studio mode where the player can practice their mixing skills, and can also sample custom tracks from other CDs to mix with in addition to the included tracks in the game.
title: DJ Wars

description: Ōedo Renaissance is an economic simulation game based on an earlier PC release. This conversion of the game retains the same general premise and structure, but makes several major changes; most notably, the game has changed from a real-time progression to turn-based, with the player deciding all their actions and policy changes on a month-by-month basis. This version also completely overhauls the visual style, with an isometric perspective of the city and a new cartoonish look to the characters. It also puts more emphasis on story elements and specific objectives to provide more guidance to the player over the sandbox experience of the original game.
title: Ōedo Renaissance

description:
In the distant future of the year UC 1715, Earth's solar system is suddenly attacked by an unknown alien force. A young cadet named Nagumo is on board one of the attacked ships, but the ship's crew are saved by a relic of a mysterious ancient civilization that had been hidden on Jupiter: the Grandread-class starship Dragonalis, which has a will of its own and recognizes Nagumo as its captain. The last hope for humanity now falls under the command of of this young man.

Grandread is a space opera hex-strategy game in which the player controls fleets of space battleships in turn-based combat. The player controls many ships at any given time, which each have varying capabilities and weaponry, and can even move multiple ships into a formation to control them as a single unit. There are multiple factions interacting in the story, and depending on the player's actions it is possible to ally with or even recruit many enemy units, and the game includes multiple endings and branching story paths.
title: Grandread

description: This deluxe release of Sangokushi V includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook and map.
title: Sangokushi V (Premium Pack)

description: This deluxe release of Sangokushi Koumeiden includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook.
title: Sangokushi Koumeiden (Premium Pack)

description: This deluxe release of Sangokushi Eiketsuden includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook.
title: Sangokushi Eiketsuden (Premium Pack)

description: This deluxe release of New Horizons includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook.
title: Daikōkai Jidai II (Premium Pack)

description: This deluxe release of Taikō Risshiden II includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook and map.
title: Taikō Risshiden II (Premium Pack)

description: This deluxe release of Bandit Kings of Ancient China includes the game along with a printed strategy guidebook.
title: Suikoden: Tenmei no Chikai (Premium Pack)

description:
This limited-edition release of Kuro no Danshō: The Literary Fragment includes the game along with a set of five trading cards and a bonus disc. The bonus disc is meant for use with a computer rather than Sega Saturn, and contains:

  • An image library showing character, background, and CG illustrations with comparisons between the PC98 and Sega Saturn versions of the game.
  • A soundtrack selection (18 tracks) plus voice outtakes (3 tracks)
title: Kuro no Danshō: The Literary Fragment (Genteiban)

description:
This bundle package includes the following items:

  • Virtua Cop 2 game
  • Stunner light gun (called Virtua Gun outside North America)
title: Virtua Cop 2 (Stunner Bundle)

description:
This bundle includes three pieces of software for exclusive use with the Sega Saturn Modem, collected onto one disc:

  • Habitat II (online virtual world game, previously only sold bundled with a keyboard accessory)
  • Pad Nifty 1.1 (message board browser software, previously only sold bundled with the Modem accessory)
  • An internet browser application
title: Pad Nifty 1.1 & Habitat II

description: This limited-edition release of Yu-No includes the game along with a Sega Saturn Shuttle Mouse accessory.
title: Yu-No: Kono Yo no Hate de Koi o Utau Shōjo (Shuttle Mouse Tsuki Genteiban)

description:
Sokkō Seitokai: Sonic Council is a 2D fighting game based on the manga of the same title by Masashi Ogawa. The story is set in a high school and focuses on the titular "Sonic Council", a student council at the school made up of students with so-called "tetsuwan" powers that let them use fighting-game style moves and techniques, and who will take on all challengers in order to keep the peace at their school.

The game includes nine playable characters, with an additional three available to unlock. There is a single-player story mode, a versus mode against the computer or a second player, a survival mode where the player must defeat as many opponents as possible with a single life bar and limited recovery options, and a training mode.
title: Sokkō Seitokai: Sonic Council

description: Keriotosse! is an overhead-view arcade action game where the goal is simple: kick everyone else out of the arena! Four combatants enter each arena, and the winner is the last one left standing on the platform. Each circular arena has different hazards such as a volcano erupting in the center, ice physics, or the entire platform tilting back and forth. There are six playable characters to pick from, with several additional unlockable characters, and there is a story mode with eight stages and a boss plus a free-battle mode for up to four players.
title: Keriotosse!

description:
Find Love 2: Rhapsody is a love adventure game based on the Zenkoku Seifuku Bishōjo Grand Prix series of illustration collections. The protagonist is a high school student and aspiring musician who has been asked by his father to manage a condo building he owns in a resort town over the summer. This condo building just so happens to be the summer home of many beautiful young ladies from all over the country, and our hero hopes that he might, as the title suggests, find love with one of the ladies there.

The game is structured like other love simulation games such as Tokimeki Memorial, with the player improving various attributes and visiting various locations each day in hopes of meeting a particular girl. During conversations, the player can choose what tone to take, between normal, wild, and confident, which will affect that girl's reaction and affection level. The player's stats will affect their chances with each girl, as well as their potential as a pop star, and there is even a rhythm mini-game to help the protagonist practice with his guitar. The jigsaw puzzle mode of the first game also returns as a minigame with new illustrations.
title: Find Love 2: Rhapsody

description:
Choro Q Park is a combat relay racing game based on Takara's Choro Q line of toy cars. It includes dozens of different vehicles to collect, which can each be customized in both stats and color, and five different race areas each with numerous course layouts. Racers can pick up weapons on the track such as oil slicks and tires to launch at other vehicles to slow them down. A unique aspect is the "change" system, which lets the player select different cars to use in different sections of the track.

The main Choro Q Island campaign mode has the player completing various races and collecting coins in order to unlock and purchase more vehicles. There is also a free race mode for one or two players.
title: Choro Q Park

description:
In the Kingdom of Dilma, dignitaries from many other nations have gathered for the coronation of the new king. However, before the ceremony takes place, a treasure of the kingdom, a priceless jewel integral to the ceremony, has been stolen from the prince's bedroom. The suspect fled into the castle's dungeon, and the prince went after them but has not returned. There are five suspects who do not have an alibi: five beautiful princesses from other countries. The young knight Willow has been summoned to investigate, find the thief, and recover the stolen jewel.

Princess Quest is a first-person dungeon-crawler RPG with love adventure elements. The player controls Willow to investigate the theft, and Willow is also able to magically transform into a female form called Will. Willow and Will have different combat abilities, with Willow adept at physical attacks while Will excels at magic, and during the investigation some characters will only be willing to speak openly to one form or the other. The player can return to Willow's room in the castle to switch forms.

The player can explore the castle and surrounding town from a top-down perspective to speak with other characters and obtain clues and information. The dungeons are explored in first-person with up to two of the princesses accompanying the player. Only Willow/Will participates directly in the turn-based combat, while the other two characters provide special abilities to help the player.

The first-print limited edition of the game includes a set of three trading cards but is otherwise identical.
title: Princess Quest

alternate_titles.title: Lupin the 3rd: The Sage of Pyramid

description:
Following the discovery of a mysterious inverted pyramid in Egypt, master thief Lupin and his crew head straight there looking for a treasure hidden within, a jewel called "The Eye of Muiran". But with an ancient curse, mysterious soldiers, and Inspector Zenigata from Interpol all after Lupin, it won't be as easy as just walking in and taking it.

Lupin the 3rd: The Sage of Pyramid is a 3D stealth action game based on the Lupin the 3rd anime and manga franchise. The player controls Lupin as he moves through each stage; while he can directly attack enemies with his fists and gun, it is much more effective to sneak up behind enemies to incapacitate them. The goal of each of the 14 stages is to avoid the enemies and traps, find the hidden treasures, and unlock and reach the exit to the next stage. Jigen and Goemon also appear in certain stages to help Lupin out.
title: Lupin Sansei: Pyramid no Kenja

description:
Nile-gawa no Yoake ("Dawn on the Nile River") is a city-building simulation game with war strategy elements in which the player takes the role of a Pharaoh in ancient Egypt. Starting in the capital of Memphis, the player must build the city up not just in its buildings and infrastructure, but also in its culture and military might. Population, taxes, and cultural development all determine what structures and actions are allowed, and buildings will also decay over time and must be repaired.

War can be waged with neighboring regions, and defeating them will add their territory to your own. Battles take place in real-time with the player directly issuing commands to their army. The ultimate goal of the game is to unify the entirety of the Mediterranean under your Pharaoh's rule. If the Pharaoh dies, their successor will continue their rule, though this can only happen a certain number of times before the game is over.
title: Nile-gawa no Yoake

description: This Sega Saturn release of Photo Genic includes the game along with an audio drama mini CD and a mini art book. This package was the only release of the game for the Sega Saturn.
title: Photo Genic

description: Sakura Wars: Steam Radio Show is a multimedia fan disc and newsletter for the Sakura Wars series. It contains video and photos of Sakura Wars events and shows, cast interviews, a music selection, and several mini-games. The main game feature is Feeling Couple, a short visual novel-style story in which the player invites one of the six girls on a date. There is also a selection of other small mini-games each centered around one of the characters, such as an indoor curling game with Sakura, a karate chop game with Kanna, and a robot-building game with Kohran.
title: Sakura Wars: Steam Radio Show

description:
Game Basic for SegaSaturn is a game development and programming kit which uses a version of the BASIC programming language. It supports keyboard input directly, includes various tools such as a paint tool and a music sequencer, and is packaged with a communication cable and PC software for transferring programs to and from a Windows PC for easier development. Various premade sample graphical and sound assets are also included, notably including a selection of music tracks from Game Arts games.

There are a total of 43 sample programs included on the disc; while many of these are tools or simple demos, there are also 12 sample games of varying complexity. Sample games include a first-person 3D maze game, a 3D jetpack flight game, and even a complete conversion of the 1984 MSX game Theseus.
title: Game Basic for SegaSaturn

description: Grandia: Digital Museum is a fan disc containing production materials and bonus content for the game Grandia. It is presented as a museum which the characters are visiting, and there is a dungeon which the player can explore to fight monsters and unlock additional materials for viewing in the museum portion. In addition to a gallery of production artwork, there is also a radio drama with a new scenario not in the main game, a bestiary, and a selection of save files which can be used in the main game to replay the game's most famous moments.
title: Grandia: Digital Museum

description:
Shadows of the Tusk is a multiplayer deck-building strategy game. Players take turns summoning creatures to fight for them, and giving them orders to attack the opposing player. Each player has a deck of cards which each represent a specific creature or character, and a pool of 30 mana with which to summon creatures or perform actions. Each character has specific stats and abilities, with stronger characters generally requiring more mana to summon or use their skills. Mana can be replenished by placing creatures on certain tiles, and the goal of each match is to defeat the opponent's leader.

The game includes several modes. The story mode includes eight stages which each unlocks additional cards for the player's deck, and functionally acts as a tutorial. Practice mode lets the player try out new decks, while *Ante" mode lets the player wager their cards in a match against the computer to acquire new cards. There is also a two-player versus mode with both local play and network play via the XBand service. There are 40 total cards to collect and up to eight different decks can be saved.
title: Shadows of the Tusk

description: Kōdō Saisoku Densetsu: Initial D is a downhill drift racing game based on the Initial D manga and anime franchise. The main scenario mode recreates a series of races from the original manga; defeating a rival in this mode will unlock their car for use in other modes. There is also a battle mode where the player can choose any of the four courses, plus a car and a rival, and race against the computer. There is also a time attack mode which lets the player save ghost replays of their best times, and a specialized drift practice mode.
title: Kōdō Saisoku Densetsu: Initial D

description: Hatsukoi Monogatari is a life sim/love adventure game and a remake of the 1993 PC game of the same title. While the story and gameplay are largely identical to the original version, this remake adds a new character — the angel Liliana — along with new events and endings. The artwork has also been completely redone in a different style, with new character designs by a different artist than the original release.
title: Hatsukoi Monogatari

description:
Waku Waku Monster is a competitive falling-block puzzle game similar to Puyo Puyo, with the addition of light monster-raising elements. The player drops individual colored creatures into a well, and if three of the same color touch, they will be cleared and vanish; creatures above will fall to take their place, and chain combos will launch garbage block attacks at the other player. Clearing blocks also fills a meter, which can be used to cancel out incoming attacks. Clear capsule blocks also occasionally appear; these will capture whichever creature they land on, feeding it to the player's monster, which will upgrade the player's monster after the match and lead to various evolutionary forms which result in various garbage drop patterns.

The game includes a single-player story mode, as well as a two-player versus mode; only the story mode includes the monster-raising elements.
title: Waku Waku Monster

description:
Sorvice is a roguelike action RPG with a card-collection element to combat and progression. The game is divided into two main parts, both accessible from the overworld map. In the quest mode, the player fights their way through a dungeon of 100 floors, similar to the Mystery Dungeon series, collecting cards, items, and money; the dungeon layout is randomly generated and is different on every attempt. In the duel mode, the player fights one-on-one against various opponents in an arena, with the story advancing as the player increases their ranking. Both modes let the player create a deck of cards which allow for using various attack and defense abilities and even to summon creatures to help fight; there are over 800 unique cards and items to find.

There are two playable characters to choose from: Rude is seeking revenge for the murder of his adoptive father, while Altina is searching for her missing brother. Each character has different abilities a unique story, and will find different cards in the dungeon. There is also a multiplayer mode which allows two players to fight a duel, as well as to trade cards.
title: Sorvice

description:
Mizuki Shigeru no Yōkai Zukan: Sōshū-hen is a Japanese-style adventure game plus a multimedia database of yōkai (spirits and ghosts of Japanese folklore) featuring illustrations and commentary by yōkai scholar and GeGeGe no Kitarō creator Shigeru Mizuki. The database portion collects together the contents of three prior PC releases with information on a total of over 950 different yōkai.

In the game section, the player has come to Mizuki-sensei's home to become his disciple, but he has gone missing. The player visits various locations to search for the missing professor, and encounters many different yōkai in combat along the way. Combat is non-traditional; rather than attacking them directly, the player must use their knowledge of the various spirits to select the correct action or response to safely ward them off.
title: Mizuki Shigeru no Yōkai Zukan: Sōshū-hen

description:
Nao Katsuragi is a popular idol, but scandal breaks out after a photo surfaces of a late-night meeting between her and Shinya Tatsumi, the son of the president of her talent agency. The ensuing media frenzy leads to both Shinya, and Nao's manager Yui Tachibana, committing suicide, and Nao herself disappears shortly thereafter. The whole scandal however was a setup meant to frame Nao and destroy her reputation.

Kindaichi Shōnen no Jikenbo: Hoshimitō Kanashimi no Fukushūki is a crime adventure game based on the Kindaichi Case Files manga and anime franchise. Unlike other games based on the property, the player does not control Kindaichi; rather, each of the two scenarios tasks the player with committing a "perfect crime" without being caught by Kindaichi. The first scenario casts the player as Nao Katsuragi, who wants revenge on whoever framed her and left two innocent people dead; the second casts the player as Takuya Asagiri, who was engaged to Yui and wants revenge on those who took his fiancee from him.

The game consists primarily of visual novel-style adventure sequences, with the player regularly given choice prompts for how to respond or proceed in the given situation. There are also occasional action stealth sequences where the player must avoid detection. The slightest inconsistency or suspicious action will likely lead Kindaichi to discover your plot, leading to a game over. Getting arrested, killed, or even just failing to commit the crime at all will also result in a game over.
title: Kindaichi Shōnen no Jikenbo: Hoshimitō Kanashimi no Fukushūki

description:
Super Keirin is a bicycle racing game based specifically on keirin cycle racing, produced by the Japan Keirin Association. Keirin races are professional bicycle races held on an oval track; at the start of a race, competitors must remain behind a pace cyclist, which gradually increases in speed before leaving the track in the latter part of the race when the competitors sprint for final position. Races have a field of 9 competitors and take place on tracks either 333m, 400m, or 500m in length.

The game includes a single race mode for up to four human players against the computer, a basic career mode, a watch mode, and a database of information on real-life keirin tracks. It was a promotional item given away at Keirin events related to the sport's 50th anniversary in 1998, and was never sold at retail.
title: Big Thanks Super Keirin: Dream With Keirin 50 Years

description:
Wangan Trial Love is a street racing game combined with a love adventure game. It is a follow-up to Wangan Dead Heat, though with a much brighter cartoon style and a cast of cute anime girls rather than the real life models of the previous titles. The main story mode includes two different scenarios: a middle-school scenario where only kart racing on a closed track is available, and there are three girls to pursue; and a much deeper high-school scenario which includes street racing across eight tracks, car tuning options, and eight different girls as potential romantic interests.

The simulation elements progress largely automatically but can be interrupted at any time to perform specific actions, such as to call one of the girls, go shopping for car parts or clothes, or enter a race. The player's stats will change and grow as the game progresses, which affects which characters they'll be able to meet and what events are available. The player can also take part time jobs (presented as short mini-games) to earn cash for upgrading their car. The game also includes a free race mode for one or two players.
title: Wangan Trial Love

description:
War between the Lafalue Kingdom and the Balt Empire has raged for centuries, with no signs of an end to the conflict. During a brief truce, prince Ray Brightforce of Lafalue and princess Fiona Fogerty of Balt have a chance meeting and fall in love. The two of them are determined to finally bring an end to the war, and they join forces with a resistance group called Valhollian.

Zanma Chō Ōgi Valhollian is a turn-based strategy RPG in the vein of Shining Force. In each turn, the player is able to act with each of their party members to move, attack, or use items or special techniques; after all characters have acted, the computer then takes a turn to do the same, repeating until one side is defeated. The game is broken into a total of 16 chapters, and has a specific focus on the bonds between characters. Characters can team up for combination attacks, which pools their strength together and can result in additional combat effects and even special story events involving those characters.
title: Zanma Chō Ōgi Valhollian

description:
Langrisser Tribute is a deluxe collector's edition containing every entry in the Langrisser series released for the Sega Saturn. This package includes:

  • Langrisser: Dramatic Edition
  • Langrisser III
  • Langrisser IV
  • Langrisser V: The End of Legend

The games are packaged in a plastic sleeve, and also included are a hardcover manual and a telephone card with Langrisser art.
title: Langrisser Tribute

description:
Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers - Extra Dungeon is an expansion content disc for the Sega Saturn version of Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers. It requires a completed save file for the main game to function, and contains a new multi-part dungeon for the player to explore, with multiple new boss enemies to fight. This content was included in the later PlayStation and Nintendo DS ports of Soul Hackers.

The disc was never sold at retail and was only available through a mail-in contest held by publisher Atlus. Only 1000 copies are thought to exist.
title: Devil Summoner: Soul Hackers - Extra Dungeon

description: This limited-edition release of Jungle Park: Saturn Shima includes the game along with a monkey-shaped keychain and a limited edition "special booklet".
title: Jungle Park: Saturn Shima (Gentei Special Package Ban)

description: This Graduation Commemorative Set edition of Tokimeki Memorial Drama Series: Vol.3 - Tabidachi no Uta includes the game along with a mini photo album and a poster packaged in a diploma case. This deluxe edition was the only release of the game for the Sega Saturn.
title: Tokimeki Memorial Drama Series: Vol.3 - Tabidachi no Uta (Sotsugyō Kinen Set)

description: This Sega Saturn port of Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2 adds one new romance option (Tomomi Aizawa) and significant new scenario content compared to the original PC release. This version also censors the explicit sexual content.
title: Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2

description:
This compilation includes both volumes of the Falcom Classics remake collections, for a total of five games across two discs:

  • Falcom Classics
  • Falcom Classics II
title: Falcom Classics Collection

description: This reissue of Desire includes the game along with a set of trading cards, a 1998–1999 mini calendar, a bonus booklet, and a demo disc for EVE: The Lost One.
title: Desire (Premium Pack)

description:
This bundle package includes the following games:

  • EVE Burst Error
  • Desire
  • A demo disc for EVE: The Lost One
title: EVE Burst Error & Desire Value Pack

description:
This bundle package includes the following games:

  • EVE: The Lost One
  • Desire
title: EVE: The Lost One & Desire Value Pack

description: This bundle package includes Gungriffon II along with a serial Link Cable accessory.
title: Gungriffon II (Taisen Cable Dōkonban)
